creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
The HTTP Sampler will URL-encode all parameter names and values no matter what.
This makes it impossible to send a slash or a colon (for example) in a QueryString.

This has been limiting work in at least one occasion (ATG Dynamo has a trick to
choose which server in a load balanced cluster you want to hit, but you need to
pass a ":" in an HTTP parameter value for it to work).

I understand the advantage of having JMeter do the URL-encoding for you, but
there's also disadvantages: one is the lack of flexibility described by this
bug, the other is the performance penalty incurred (even in the absence of the
JDK 1.4.0 URLEncoder bug).

Maybe adding yet another option in HTTPSamplers to choose whether you want it to
URL-encode your parameters?

A third approach would be to have a less strict URL encoding that only encodes
characters outside the 33-126 range and the "&" and "=" characters.
